page.title: 03Sheep Farming
page.content:
There are two main breeds of sheep which are common in this area. The first of these is the Cheviot(South Country) Sheep. This breed does best on coarse grass rather than heather and is a good lamb producer. Both sexes are hornless.
The Scottish Blackfaced Breed does better on the heather moorlands. Both ewes and rams have horns. They are reared mainly for meat. There are several other breeds suited to this arealike the Swaledale, Jacob, Suffolk, Border Leicester and the Texel. These are pure bred.The two main cross breeds are the mule which is a Blackface Ewe crossed with a Bluefaced Leicester Tup.The second cross breed is a half bred which is a Border Leicester crossed with a south country Cheviot.
